info.name: erf(x) & erf⁻¹(x)
info.description:
good approximation of erf function  ( light green )
red: gaussian    blue: derivative of erf: ultra close.

not so bad approx of reciprocal (cyan) derived from not so bad approx of erf ( dark green )
grey:  Ierf(erf(x))   dark-red: y=x : ultra-close.

renderpass.code:
#define P  ( sqrt(3.14159265359)/2. )

float erf(float x) {                        // very good approx https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Error_function
    float e = exp(-x*x);                    // ( Bürmann series )
    return sign(x)/P * sqrt( 1. - e ) * ( P + 31./200.*e - 341./8000. *e*e );
}

#define erf0(x)     tanh(1.2*(x))           // not so bad approx, with easy reciprocal
#define Ierf(x) ( atanh(x) / 1.2 )          // not so bad reciprocal

#define gauss(x,s)    exp(-.5*(x)*(x) / ((s)*(s)) )

#define plot(v)     clamp( 1.- abs(v-y) / fwidth(v-y) , 0.,1.)

#define deriv(f)   ( ( f(x) - f(x-1e-3) ) /1e-3 )

void mainImage( out vec4 O, vec2 u )
{
    vec2 R = iResolution.xy,
         U = ( 2.*u - R ) /R.y;
    float x = U.x, y = U.y, v;
    
    O.g = plot( erf(x) );                   // erf
    O.b = plot( P * deriv(erf) );           // derivative of erf
    O.r = plot( gauss( x, 1./sqrt(2.)) );   // gaussian, for comparison
    
    O.g  += .3* plot( erf0(x) );            // lesser approx of erf
    O.gb += .8* plot( Ierf(x) );            // reciprocal
    O    += .5* plot( Ierf(erf(x)) );       // erf⁻¹(erf)
    O.r  += .5*plot( x );                   // y=x, for comparison
    
    O += plot(0.);
    O = sqrt(O);                            // to sRGB
}
